results.title: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace
results.brief_description: Anakin Skywalker, a young slave strong with the Force, is discovered on Tatooine. Meanwhile, the evil Sith have returned, enacting their plot for revenge against the Jedi.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

results.title: Star wars. Ep. 1: The Phantom menace [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Rick McCallum and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: Another instalment in the “Star Wars” series - with a difference - director George Lucas choosing to trace what happened prior to the “original” “Star Wars” film, rather than following on from “The Return of the Jedi”. Obi-Wan Kenobi (Ewan McGregor), a young Jedi knight, is training under his mentor, Qui-Gon Jinn (Liam Neeson). When the planet Naboo is cut off by the Trade Federation, the Jedi Council orders Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon to settle the problem. They arrive in Naboo and meet Queen Amidala (Natalie Portman) who joins them on the trip to Coruscant to meet the Trade Federation. Unfortunately, they encounter difficulties with their spacecraft and are forced to make an emergency landing on Tatooine. While there, they meet Anakin Skywalker (Jake Lloyd), a slave boy, who will eventually father Luke Skywalker and become known as Darth Vader. Qui-Gon becomes convinced that Anakin is the leader the Jedi’s have been seeking and makes a bet to free Anakin from the slave contract he is bound to. On return to Naboo, war breaks out and the Jedi’s must fight against Darth Sidious (Ian McDiarmid), leader of the Trade Federation and his deadly henchman, dark Jedi, Darth Maul (Ray Park). One of the most anticipated films of the 90s, “The Phantom menace” includes cameo roles from Samuel L. Jackson and Terence Stamp.

results.title: Star Wars Uncut: Director's Cut
results.brief_description: In 2009, Casey Pugh asked thousands of Internet users to remake “Star Wars: A New Hope” into a fan film, 15 seconds at a time. Contributors were allowed to recreate scenes from Star Wars however they wanted. Within just a few months SWU grew into a wild success. The creativity that poured into the project was unimaginable.

results.title: Star Wars Battlefront
results.brief_description: Star Wars: Battelfront allows players to blast or lightsabre their way through some of the most iconic battles from the Star Wars universe.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

results.description:
In 2004, the original Star Wars: Battlefront came onto the scene and took gamers – and Star Wars fans – by surprise. It was an ambitious action shooter that gave players the opportunity to step into the shoes of their favorite Star Wars characters, pilot quintessential Star Wars vehicles, and relive classic Star Wars battles.

Fast forward nearly 10 years and gamers still have many of those same Star Wars gaming fantasies – but now they wish to experience those larger-than-life battles in magnificent high definition, with all of the amazing special effects, vehicle physics and gameplay intensity that the next-generation has to offer.

Star Wars Battlefront, developed by DICE on Frostbite 3, will surprise and delight fans yet again with a new experience inside this beloved universe made with our signature DICE craftsmanship and commitment to excellence.

results.title: Star wars (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Princess Leia is captured by the evil imperial forces in their efforts to take over the galactic Empire. Venturesome Luke Skywalker and dashing space captain Han Solo team together with the lovable Droids C-3PO and R2D2 to restore justice to the universe.

results.title: Star Wars
results.brief_description: George Lucas’ blockbuster space opera that helped usher in the modern era of movies features instantly iconic characters from Luke Skywalker and Han Solo to Princess Leia and Darth Vader.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Innovation, technology and design: Edweard Muybridge
constellations_other.description: A focus on the discovery, inspiration and innovation at the heart of moving image history

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

constellations_other.name: One of the first auteurs
constellations_other.description: A progenitor of modern film genres such as sci-fi, psychological thriller and serial killer films decades before such terms were coined, Austrian-born director Fritz Lang also enjoyed the occasional on-screen meta-moment.

results.description: Princess Leia is captured and held hostage by the evil Imperial forces in their effort to take over the galactic Empire. Venturesome Luke Skywalker and dashing captain Han Solo team together with the loveable robot duo R2-D2 and C-3PO to rescue the beautiful princess and restore peace and justice in the Empire.
description_for_label: Princess Leia is captured and held hostage by the evil Imperial forces in their effort to take over the galactic Empire. Venturesome Luke Skywalker and dashing captain Han Solo team together with the loveable robot duo R2-D2 and C-3PO to rescue the beautiful princess and restore peace and justice in the Empire.

results.title: Star wars
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A Long time ago in a galaxy far far away, George Lucas’s space adventure captured the hearts and imaginations of film lovers of all ages from the moment these words scrolled across the screen. The Empire’s evil Death Star must be destroyed. The heroes, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, Han Solo and a pair of droids named R2-D2 and C-3PO, as part of the Rebel Alliance, must pit their strength against the might of the Empire and the evil Jedi, Darth Vader. With the help of an old Jedi Knight, Obi-Wan Kenobi, they battle the forces of darkness and triumph. The special effects and famous “Star wars” theme music has ensured that this film takes its place in cinema history. Includes a ten minute interview between George Lucas and Leonard Maltin.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

results.title: Star trek: the motion picture
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Jon Povill, Gene Roddenberry, Century Associates and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: When a destructive space entity is spotted approaching Earth, Admiral Kirk resumes command of the Starship Enterprise in order to intercept, examine, and hopefully stop it. With it’s relentless flight towards Earth “V’ger’s” bloody-minded pursuit to find it’s “Creator”, Kirk and crew face possible Armageddon. Cast also includes Persis Khambatta as Lieutenant Ilia and Stephen Collins as Commander Decker. Interesting note: When Spock travels through V’ger and sees all the incredible imagery, look out for Darth Vader and Miss Piggy - right after his line “Who or what are we dealing with?”. Written by Allen Dean Foster. Original music by Jerry Goldsmith. Cinematography by Richard H. Kline.

results.title: Star trek III: the search for Spock
results.creator_credit: Leonard Nimoy, Harve Bennett and Harve Bennett Productions
results.brief_description: The third in the series of feature films based on the original television series by Gene Roddenberry is set in the 23rd Century, the planet Genesis has been born, but at a great and terrible price - the death of Captain Spock. As per tradition, his body is consigned to deep space and the battered starship Enterprise limps back home. Lt. Saavik and Dr. David Marcus arrive on the forbidden planet to begin their research, unaware that their discoveries are also of great importance to the Klingon Battle Commander Kruge (played by Christopher Lloyd), who will stop at nothing to gain control of the secrets of this new world for the Klingon Empire. The revelations regarding Genesis will impel Captain Kirk and the Enterprise crew on a mission so personal and dangerous that they will have to confront the final frontiers of revolutionary science and the arcane rituals of Vulcan mysticism. Cast includes William Shatner, DeForest Kelly, James Doohan, George Takei, Walter Keonig, Nichelle Nichols, Merrit Butrick and actor/director Leonard Nimoy, around whom the whole story revolves.

results.title: Star trek II: the wrath of Khan
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Meyer, Robert Sallin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: It is the 23rd century and the starship U.S.S. Enterprise is on a routine training mission when an urgent communication from Space Laboratory Regula One (home of the Genesis project), is received by Admiral James T Kirk. Kirk’s old enemy, Khan, a genetically enhanced human from the Eugenics War, has appropriated a top secret device named Project Genesis and is using the universe threatening device in a deadly game of revenge. Aided by his band of genetic supermen made possible by the Project, Khan gains control of a Federation Starship and begins a desperate mission to gain control of the Enterprise. Cast includes William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and Kirstie Alley.
